qas.question: What act was the indictment under?

answers.text: Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act

qas.question: How long did Bulger remain at large?
Was Bulger on the 10 Most Wanted Fugitives List?
What did the revelations about Bulger cause?
When was Bulger tipped off by his CIA handler?
When did New England media cover up criminal actions by federal, state, and local law enforcement officials tied to Bulger?
When was John J Connolly cleared of federal racketeering charges?
Whose murder did John B Callahan help to plan?

context: In <b6_0>December 1994<b6_0/>, after being tipped off by <a0_0>his former FBI handler<a0_0/> about a pending indictment under the <a1_0>Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act<a1_0/>, <b5_0>Bulger<b5_0/> fled Boston and went into hiding. For <a2_0>16<a2_0/> years, he remained at large. For 12 of those years, Bulger was <a3_0>prominently listed<a3_0/> on the FBI Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list. Beginning in <b7_0>1997<b7_0/>, the New England media exposed criminal actions by federal, state, and local law enforcement officials tied to Bulger. The revelation caused <a4_0>great embarrassment<a4_0/> to the FBI. In <b8_0>2002<b8_0/>, Special Agent John J Connolly was convicted of federal racketeering charges for helping Bulger avoid arrest. In 2008, Special Agent <b9_0>Connolly<b9_0/> completed his term on the federal charges and was transferred to Florida where he was convicted of helping plan the murder of John B Callahan, a Bulger rival. In 2014, that conviction was overturned on a technicality. Connolly was the agent leading the investigation of Bulger.
